On the 4th of March there was a balance of 19 l. 18 s. 5 d. due to Mr. Holden for pigs delivered between five and six o'clock that morning - it was customary to settle the same day, and the prisoner came about half-past ten o'clock that morning, which was rather earlier than usual - he said he called for Mr. Holden's bill for articles sent by Fielden and Sadler. I thought it was all right, and I paid him nineteen sovereigns, seven half-crowns, and one shilling, and he gave me 1 d. In about a hour and a half Mr. Holden came for the bill; I told him I had paid his man; he said he had not told him to come, but perhaps he had taken it home - I saw the prisoner about a fortnight afterwards at Guildhall.

WILLIAM THACKER
. I saw the prisoner apprehended, and saw him searched; he had no money about him at all - he denied having received this bill.
GUILTY .
Confined Nine Months .

855.
EDWARD HEMMINGS
was indicted for
a fraud .

LEWIS RICHARDSON COLES
. I am the servant of
John Moreland
, an umbrella manufacturer , who lives in the Minories - I know the prisoner very well. On the 31st of March he came to our shop, about half-past three o'clock, and brought a written order, signed by Mr. Barnes, which order lost - it was for four 4 feet 9 inches silk umbrellas - they were invoiced at 4 l. 18 s.; the value of them was about 4 l. 8 s.; they were booked to the credit of Mr.
Henry Barnes
, No. 13, St. Martin's-court. When I read the order I told the prisoner it was not Mr. Barnes's writing; he said Mr. Barnes was out, and Mrs. Barnes wrote it - I believed that, and gave him the goods he applied for. Mr. Barnes came to our house on the 2d of April, and I asked him how he approved of the articles; I then found I had been imposed upon. About half-past five o'clock the same evening the prisoner brought another order for two more of the same kind, as from Mr. Barnes; we sent for an officer, and gave charge of him. I knew he had formerly worked for Mr. Barnes, and supposed all was right.

HENRY BARNES. I deal with Mr. Moreland. The prisoner had been in my employ about seven years, but had left me about nine months; he had no authority to apply for any umbrellas, on my account, on the 31st of March - he had no order given him to get them, and I have never seen them.
Prisoner's Defence. I must leave myself to the mercy of the Court - it was distress that caused me to do it.
GUILTY .
Confined Three Months .

856.
HENRY HALL
was indicted for
a misdemeanor .

UNDERWOOD PRICE
. I am an ironmonger ; I live at No. 13, Cow-lane, St. Sepulchre's
. I have an area to my house. On the 25th of March, I went to bed about eleven o'clock at night, and next morning I found three of the squares in the area window had been broken; a man could have put his arm in and unbolted the window; the prisoner had been in my employ for three years as an errand boy - but I had discharged him on the Saturday before.

THOMAS PUGH. I am servant to Mr. Price; it is the warehouse window which was broken; it was safe after dusk; I was up stairs and heard the window broken; I came down and called the watch; I took two watchmen inside, and left one outside; we found the prisoner in the area, in a state of concealment; he must have lifted up a heavy grating to have got down; there were three squares broken quite out, and some more cracked; he could then have undone the fastenings.

JAMES WILLIAMS
. I am a watchman. I was on Snow-hill, and was called to Mr. Price's house; I found the prisoner in the area; the window was broken, and the frame of the window had been wrenched four or five inches - he did not appear to be at all in liquor or insensible.

JOHN SHEPPERD
. I was the constable of the night. The prisoner was brought to me; I found a piece of liver, and a phosphorous box on him; and in the area, we found a small iron crow, which they call a jemmy, and a knife.

The prisoner put in a written Defence; stating that he had met two men, who made him intoxicated, and then gave him a crow-bar, and lifted up the area grating and persuaded him to go down, which he refused, but they forced him down, and in the scuffle the glass was broken.
GUILTY .

Confined One Year and
Publicly Whipped .
